docs.lead_paragraph: The sharpest attacks in the Democratic campaign thus far - and the ones that have provoked the most emotion in partisan blogs and columns - involve, oddly enough, health-care mandates. Even when I mentioned the other day on the blog that I was thinking of delving into mandates this week, I got a flood of passionate e-mails from very smart people on the subject, trying to sway me one way or the other. This tells me two things: one, I need to change my e-mail address, and two, the fight about mandates is about something deeper than mandates.
docs.abstract: The sharpest attacks in the Democratic campaign thus far - and the ones that have provoked the most emotion in partisan blogs and columns - involve, oddly enough, health-care mandates.
docs.snippet: The sharpest attacks in the Democratic campaign thus far - and the ones that have provoked the most emotion in partisan blogs and columns - involve, oddly enough, health-care mandates.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Bush’s strategies that brought him political victories this week on Capitol Hill have left many wondering why the most powerful dealmaker in Washington is not practicing the art of the deal.
